title: I'm a Zed main and I'd like to share my thoughts
body:
Before you start down-voting me to oblivion let me please have a conversation with you.  I actually AGREE that Zed is in a bad spot right now and does need some changes.  But I would like to share my thoughts on Zed. 

**A quick preface**
I have been a Zed player since mid season 3.  He quickly became my favorite champion, and I played him through ALL metas.  When he was strong or weak or OP, or whatever.  Changing Zed will not change my desire to play him, and playing him through all the changes in the game since mid season 3 has given me a pretty objective perspective on him and his strengths/weaknesses.

**Can Zed's kit be balanced?**
A lot of people have short memories.  Early to mid season 4, this game was considerably different.  At that time, Lulu, Soraka and Ori were the dominant mid laners and the meta called for support style mids to support the strong bruiser/carry style junglers and and AD carries.  At this time, Zed was not considered OP, in fact, anytime someone would complain about Zed on the forums they were usually down-voted into obscurity.  Alas, the meta has changed -- assassins are on the rise again, and Zed has taken the forefront.  

I have read a ton of threads in the past month that have said that "Zed can simply not be balanced...  His kit is just way to strong."  And I think that it only takes looking back 3 short months to see a time when he was considered a bad pick in both competitive play and solo-que.  So a massive overhaul is not what Zed needs, he doesn't need a rework and he doesn't need a changed ultimate.  His balancing issue is strictly a numbers problem.  

**Why so OP all of a sudden**
His buffs this summer were not the reason for him being considered OP right now.  The meta has just happened to shift back to him being in a dominant position.  I mean, think about it, the mids rising to popularity right now are all similar to Zed (assassins with good lanning-phases and roam potential).  This is due mostly to the changes in the jungle, discouraging, or at least evening out, early game pressure.  

Once Zed is nerfed, which is probably inevitable at this point, he will no longer be over-shadowing the major problems with EVERY assassin, not just Zed.  And pretty much every popular assassin right now has the same issues.  So if we are going to put Zed under a microscope and talk about his strengths, we should probably do the same with other assassins that have similar kits.

**The other strong assassins**
{{champion:105}} 
I think that if we are going to talk about Zed not having the "risk vs reward" play style that assassins are suppose to have, then Fizz should be right there next to him.  Every problem concerning Zed right now can be applied to Fizz with the exception of being manaless.

{{champion:7}} 
With the changes to her W, she is once again strong, and will surely make a come back.  Plenty of wave clear, and a very safe playstyle with considerable burst.

{{champion:55}} 
She was just recently nerfed, but still the same issues.  Including being manaless.

{{champion:84}} 
Not the same wave clear as the champs above but enough damage to easily put Zed to shame while having a crazy safe play style and no mana.

{{champion:103}} 
Ahri is in a weird spot, really strong but very  under-played.  I expect she will make an excellent come back.  But maybe not necessary on this list.

All these champs have glaring issues with the meta right now, and any one of them could be in Zed's spot easily.  I think as a community we need to examine the role in general, not just Zed.

**What Zed needs**
I think Zed is in need of some nerfs, and here are my thoughts.  First, death mark cooldown at levels 1 and 2, should be higher.  It is up to often in the lanning phase for mages to have opportunities for counter play. Next, his W should have a significantly longer cooldown, but the cooldown reduction from his E should be applied only on Zed's E not his shadow, and be much higher.  This means that Zed still has sticking potential, but not as much safety, poke in lane without taking risks.  Finally his Q damage should be slightly reduced at early levels.  

tl;dr
Zed needs changes, but every assassin does, let's not go crazy here with all the Zed hate, he CAN be balanced.

good post, i mostly agree and i think i could sum zeds current OP state in four points.

1) the jungle changes have made the jungle hit hard, and there are more people wandering around on low health, which is perfect for assassins like zed.

2) the recent changes to mana regen left zed unaffected while it nerfed almost all of his current and potential mid-lane counterparts. 

3) the relative strength of ad items, in particular armor pen, has massively outclassed any defensive items so it is almost impossible to itemize against him. 

4) for an assassin zed is way too safe. he gets tons of insta-pop-ing people potential with almost no drawbacks.

Hmm. As an ADC main, one of those who zeds love to blow up, zed annoys me quite a bit but I don't really have that big of a problem with him. I don't think higher death mark cooldown will change zed enough as a champion to be effective. What I'd go for with a nerf isn't a numbers change, but giving the enemy team more windows of opportunity to counter him. The changes I'd go for would be to modify zed's shurikan to work like lux's Q as far as hitting targets goes, so that it can only hit 2 instead of an entire wave, making hiding behind minions far more viable in lane. Then give his w an energy cost whenever he switches from one shadow to the next - this additional energy cost would make it so that if zed decided to engage and attempt an all in, if he doesn't hit his abilities then he won't have enough energy to immediately escape, allowing him to be poked and played with quite a lot more.

As a zed main, what are your thoughts on these ideas?

Most of the other assassins I'm not really as concerned about as much as zed, because they already have plenty of opportunities to combat them from my perspective.

I think the purpose of increasing Death Mark cooldown is to prevent him from snowballing as quickly. As it stands, Death Mark has a 120 second cooldown rank 1, that with brutalizer and masteries drops to 102 seconds. Roughly a minute 1:45, and thats not a lot of time to pressure him, considering if he kills you the respawn timer is 20 seconds at lvl 6. If it takes another 20 seconds to reach lane against, you have 1 minute before his ulti is back up. This is made worse by how safe Zed can play in that minute.

To be fair his ult CD is higher than the ult of every other mid lane assassin.

Talon has 75, also buys CDR
LB has 40, also buys CDR
Katarina 90 CD, maybe buys CDR+reset passive

And all 3 can snowball harder than Zed (though LB falls off hard if the game isn't finished quickly)

Talon will fall short in any kind of fight nowadays, even vs a squishy caster.... His silence was his only form of safety after he jumped in, now everybody can easily retaliate, and as his ult is mostly used for ganks/surprise engages, so that way of escaping isn't exactly an option either.

LB's Ult is basically a double of her basic abilities, which is not that strong in and of itself, the combo matters here.

Katarinas ult can be shut down by any kind of hard CC, which most champs(that are in the meta & played often) have plenty of nowadays.

Zed's ult is hard to counter(unlike Kata), is extremely powerful(unlike LB), and has a gapcloser AND escape component to it(unlike Talon). Basically he has hardly any counterplay to his ult unless you have QSS(who dafuq would buy MR vs Zed?) or he can't escape because his shadow timed out, both of which are rather unlikely.
Zed ult is also countered by hard CC, and common items that every role buys, and a ton of champion abilities, or just any champion with a mobility spell to quickly get away.

A large part of the issue is that most of the traditional mids (mages) use mana, while Zed obviously does not. If they attempt to rush an Armguard for the armor (or a QSS in anticipation of being dived at level 6), they'll lose out on the early-game mana regen that most of them need in order to compete with Zed's waveclear and incredibly easy last hitting. Zed can then just keep pushing until they run out of mana, then either kill them or go roaming freely.

Then there's the other side of that. Let us assume that you are able to perfectly dodge all of Zed's poke, and do not feel the need to buy armor, so you can get mana regen instead. Mana regen has recently been nerfed, to the point where you are almost guaranteed to run out of mana just trying to stop Zed from taking your turret by pushing. Buying regen helps, but it's not enough for most mages to keep up with clearing wave after wave of minions.

And even pushed up to your turret, ganking Zed is nearly useless anyway if he's halfway decent at warding with his trinket. He can just ward one side and avoid the other, and his W will make for an easy escape 90% of the time, no matter how far he pushed.

If the mage builds armor, then Zed can't kill that mage unless he or she let Zed ult them out of tower with about 1/2 health. Also, blue buff exists for a reason, get that to help with the mana problems. And, about the jungler gank--if Zed uses his W to stay alive, he can't use it to poke you. A good jg pressure will make the Zed hesitate about throwing out his W offensively, and life is SO much easier when the Zed just Q's to poke. Zed's a strong laner, because late game he can't compete with champions like Vayne and Ori, so beating him in lane is supposed to take more than beating a Kassadin in lane.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oIBR4zudWpo    

To be frank. Zed is quite overwhelming in lane. He punishes poor farmers, but at the same time holds his own against dedicated pushers while applying the burst potential of poor farmers. Only, he also guarantees his jungler blue buff + experience just for picking him. People often forget that's actually a pretty big deal.  Especially considering he get his own just by simply killing the enemy mid. And if he fails? Doesn't really matter anyways. High reward, low risk. 


The other problem, he's arguably as slippery as Lee, only also untargetable at times, and has the potential to travel over  8,000 spaces via his W and R. Yes, Leblanc can do that too. But, the difference between him and Leblanc, is Leblanc can't auto attack you to death, nor does she leave homies that can also attack people chasing him. She also doesn't build boots of mobility. 

His tower diving is also quite out of hand. He pidgeonholes anyone without an untargetable ability to immediately rush a zhonyas, or prepare to die.  That's actually a pretty big dps loss for most mages that are now so nerfed they require deathfires to reach the same burst as Zed.  So, by simply picking him you are indirectly saving your team from becoming roaming death fire killed. 

IT's actually risky to pick any assassin champ besides Fizz against him. You're better off with a more tanky/supporty mid. 


What exactly is the downside of picking Zed? Honestly, there really isn't. And what few downsides there are are easily remedied by an ap jungler, or top which isn't too uncommon to begin with. Other than that, the only real downside is there will be more zhonyas on the enemy team. But, by switching your ult to the adc, the issue is remedied anyways.

Tl;dr if you're good with Zed, there really is no reason NOT to pick him. That's kind of an issue.

I could see this being a nerf to dueling, but not his safety, which from what I have seen is what people complain about. Maybe make it so Zed can't return to his ulti shadow for X seconds?
